page.title: 14Ecology:Botany:Spring.
page.content: Beck Mill area has roadside verges marshland,old drove roads and foot- paths. Although the farmland contains few wildflowers due to chemical sprays and intensive cultivation there is a large amount of undisturbed marginal land and woodland where the following flowering plants have been noted in large numbers during 1984'85. SPRING-Chickweed,Shepherds Purse,Pansy Speedwell,Red Deadnettle,Coltsfoots, Daisy,Sweet violet,Wood Anenome,Butter cup,Dandelion,Bluebell,Kingcup,cowslip Daffodil(naturalised),Ground Ivy,Jack- by the hedge,Ox eye daisy,Herb Robert, Water avens, Strawberry,Pignut. These are just the common spring flowers identified in the North east corner of our block.
